He mentions that Znayka made a mistake by thinking certain things were bricks when they were actually a type of rock. Then the professor talks about the Moon's center, saying that if there were no bricks, there could be no little lunar creatures (corotushki-lunatiki) because they couldn't live on the inner surface due to gravity pulling everything to the center. But this is the professor's opinion, not Znayka's.

Now, paragraph 26 starts with Znayka standing up and speaking mockingly. The markdown here is "Выслушав всё это, Знайка поднялся со своего места и сказал насмешливо:" which translates to "After hearing all this, Znayka stood up from his seat and said mockingly:". This is the first mention of Znayka responding sarcastically. However, the actual comment about the professor being stuck in the Moon's center isn't here yet.
